text: Yufutsu District in Iburi and Kamikawa Subprefectures. is a district divided between Iburi and Kamikawa Subprefectures in Hokkaido, Japan. ==Towns and villages== ===Iburi Subprefecture=== *Abira (merger of Hayakita and Oiwake) *Atsuma *Mukawa ===Kamikawa Subprefecture=== *Shimukappu ==History== *1869 - With the establishment of provinces and districts in Hokkaido, Yūfutsu District, Iburi Province is created *1897 - Placed under Muroran Subprefecture (later renamed Iburi) *1906 - Shimukappu Village transferred to Kamikawa Subprefecture *1948 - Tomakomai City established, leaving Yūfutsu District *On March 27, 2006 - the towns of Hayakita and Oiwake merged to form the new town of Abira. *On March 27, 2006 - the towns of Hobetsu and Mukawa merged to form the new town of Mukawa, now with a different writing. Category:Districts in Hokkaido
title: Yūfutsu District, Hokkaido
